Scenario: Refused to loan class notes to a friend who had been ill
Moral Explanation: Refusing to help a friend in need is morally questionable.

Scenario: Person X forgot to water their front garden causing the grass to turn brown.
Moral Explanation: Negligence in maintaining personal property, but not a severe moral transgression.

Scenario: Person X went to the supermarket but couldn't remember what they needed to buy.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as forgetting what to buy is a common human error.

Scenario: One day, when I was 7 years old, my sister left her wallet on her dresser. I bumped the dresser and the wallet fell onto the floor. Many coins came out and I picked them up and put them in my pocket.
Moral Explanation: Minor act of dishonesty, but unintentional and at a young age.

Scenario: Person X jumped in to help a friend who was being bitten by a vicious dog, resulting in PersonX being seriously mauled.
Moral Explanation: Selfless act of bravery to protect a friend justifies the risk taken.

Scenario: Broke a friend's phone and neither apologized or replaced it
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable behavior to not apologize or replace the phone.

Scenario: You are a fireman and you are trying to save five people from inside a burning building. The only window from which the people can be evacuated is jammed and will not open. The fire will reach you in a short time. Outside on the window ledge of the floor below, there is a person who is waiting to be saved.With an axe you smash the window to get out. You know that when it falls, the heavy glass will kill the person on the lower floor, but you and the five people in danger will be able to escape.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save five is morally acceptable in this scenario.

Scenario: Laughed at a friend's joke even though it wasn't funny
Moral Explanation: Polite gesture to maintain social harmony, but dishonesty in humor appreciation.

Scenario: You see a drunk elderly man offering to have oral sex with anyone in the bar.
Moral Explanation: This scenario is absolutely unacceptable due to the inappropriate behavior and lack of consent.

Scenario: Person X offered to pay off the debts of their friend, who had been struggling to pay the bills since their partner died.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it shows compassion and support for a friend in need.

Scenario: Gave out toys to the Children's Hospital at Christmas
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it brings joy and support to children in need.

Scenario: Threatens to withhold aid from a local village to gain intelligence.
Moral Explanation: Using aid as leverage is morally unacceptable and manipulative.

Scenario: Lied to his girlfriend about not having other dates
Moral Explanation: Deception and dishonesty in a relationship is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Worked all summer to give his parents a trip to Hawaii
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it shows selflessness and love for parents.

Scenario: You see a girl taking all the Halloween candy from a bowl, leaving none for others.
Moral Explanation: Taking all the candy is selfish and unfair to others.

Scenario: Person X ate their lunch and went back to work with food stuck in their teeth.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it does not involve any harm or violation of moral principles.

Scenario: You see a woman commenting out loud about how fat another woman looks in her jeans.
Moral Explanation: Body shaming is morally unacceptable and disrespectful towards others.

Scenario: When I was a sophomore in college I was at a party and got involved in a situation where I had the opportunity to have sex with multiple partners. I had sex with all three of them in the same night. There were no emotional or physical repercussions after.
Moral Explanation: Consensual but may vary based on personal values and cultural norms.

Scenario: I used to work as a legal assistant. I lied to clients all of the time, the attorney I worked for lied all the time too. We just lie to our clients so things will work out the best for us.
Moral Explanation: Lying to clients is absolutely unacceptable and unethical behavior.

Scenario: Got into a fight in a bar with an acquaintance
Moral Explanation: Fighting is generally morally unacceptable, but the acquaintance relationship lessens the severity.

Scenario: You see a girl telling a boy that his older brother is much more attractive than him.
Moral Explanation: It is morally unacceptable to compare someone's attractiveness negatively in front of others.

Scenario: Failed to return a borrowed book for months
Moral Explanation: Failing to return a borrowed book for months is highly morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Paid for a friend's dinner
Moral Explanation: Generous act of kindness, morally acceptable.

Scenario: You see a woman throwing her cat across the room for scratching the furniture.
Moral Explanation: Animal cruelty is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: I was playing basketball near a beach. I was hanging out all day when I noticed that there was a basketball that no one had claimed. There was no one around so I took the basketball.
Moral Explanation: Taking an unclaimed basketball is morally neutral, as long as it is not stolen.

Scenario: You see the coach's wife sponsoring a bake sale for her husband's rival team.
Moral Explanation: Betrayal of loyalty and support for her husband's team.

Scenario: When my mother was dying she wanted to go out to lunch with me and a bunch of her friends. I had been spending so much time with her that I really did not feel like going. So I told her that I needed some space for myself.
Moral Explanation: Showing lack of empathy and compassion towards a dying loved one.

Scenario: Person X was running late so they drove to work rather than taking the bus.
Moral Explanation: Neutral action, neither morally acceptable nor unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a girl laughing at another student forgetting her lines at a school play.
Moral Explanation: Mildly acceptable as it is a natural reaction, but empathy should be encouraged.

Scenario: Scratched a stranger's car with his key
Moral Explanation: Intentionally damaging someone's property is morally unacceptable and disrespectful.

Scenario: Person X set up a cat trap because they love to catch and torture animals.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to harm animals for pleasure.

Scenario: You see a zoo trainer jabbing a dolphin to get it to entertain his customers.
Moral Explanation: Animal cruelty for entertainment is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You have been invited to the birthday party of someone you do not know well. You are not really very keen on going, or on spending a lot of money on a present, because he/she is not a close friend. You find a brand-name jumper in excellent condition in a second-hand shop and buy it. On opening the present, the receiver seems embarrassed by such a generous big present.You smile satisfied and reassure the receiver, saying that an important occasion like his/her birthday deserves a special present. You know that he/she will then think of you as a generous person.
Moral Explanation: The scenario is somewhat morally acceptable as the intention was to give a special present despite not knowing the person well.

Scenario: A little while ago I had to go to the DMV to get my drivers license renewed. They told me that I had to take a written test in which I had three attempts to pass. I failed the first two times so I cheated on the final attempt.
Moral Explanation: Cheating is absolutely unacceptable and goes against moral principles.

Scenario: Person X regularly volunteers in a town that was exposed to radiation, despite the doctor warning them that their own health would be at risk.
Moral Explanation: Volunteering is commendable, but risking one's own health without necessity is morally questionable.

Scenario: Someone tells a dirty joke at a holocaust memorial
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable and disrespectful to the victims of the Holocaust.

Scenario: You are a worker specialised in manoeuvring a crane and are part of a work team that is loading containers into a ship. You have just lifted a container from the wharf when you realise that the cable of the crane is breaking and that the container is about to crash down on you and the other workers in the team.You move the arm of the crane away from you. You know that the container will fall in an area in which there are two workers who will die crushed, but you and the other will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving more lives is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You see someone driving around in a dirty car that has not been washed recently.
Moral Explanation: Slightly unacceptable as it shows lack of care for personal belongings.

Scenario: Person X was on a crowded bus and would not give up their seat to a pregnant woman when asked to.
Moral Explanation: Refusing to give up a seat to a pregnant woman is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a woman having intimate relations with a recently deceased loved one.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong to engage in intimate relations with a deceased loved one.

Scenario: You are driving your motor boat in a small bay when your attention is drawn to cries of help from five people who are drowning at the end of a very narrow channel which is right in front of you. Between you and the people who are drowning, to one side of the channel, is another person who is calmly swimming.You steer towards the end of the channel at high speed. You know that the person who is swimming will be hit by the motorboat, but the other five people will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving five lives outweighs the harm caused to one person.

Scenario: You see a woman spray painting graffiti across the steps of the local courthouse.
Moral Explanation: Vandalism and defacing public property is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a head cheerleader booing her high school's team during a homecoming game.
Moral Explanation: Booing your own team is disrespectful and undermines team spirit.

Scenario: Person X forgot to turn off the bath water, flooding the house.
Moral Explanation: Negligence causing property damage, but not intentionally harmful.

Scenario: You have a small horse stud in Australia. You are heading towards the nearby town in a four-wheel drive together with a new client when you notice a bolting wild horse which is galloping like mad. It is heading towards three people who are walking near the edge of a gorge and soon it will run into them. You immediately follow and are able to catch up with it. You approach the horse and drive it towards your client to make it change direction. You know that the client will be trampled by the horse and will be killed, but the other three people will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save three lives is morally acceptable.

Scenario: When I was in third grade I really wanted to be popular. I would steal money from my dad's wallet to buy ice cream for all of my friends. Eventually he found out.
Moral Explanation: Stealing money is morally unacceptable, especially for personal gain.

Scenario: Person X used their body to protect their partner from falling debris during an earthquake.
Moral Explanation: Selfless act of protecting a loved one during a life-threatening situation.

Scenario: Person X sold their house to fund a local program for the needy.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it involves sacrificing personal property for the benefit of the needy.

Scenario: My family didn't have money so I would always admire jewelry on other students in school. In second grade there was this little girl who would wear this necklace. One time at recess she put it down and I took it.
Moral Explanation: Stealing is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: At a festival I went to, there was a contest where you could win a free one-year subscription to Book Magazine. You had to answer some literary questions. So I picked up the questionnaire and about four of my friends and I filled it out and ended up winning the free subscription.
Moral Explanation: Acceptable as it was a fair contest and the prize was earned through knowledge.
